intro: Agelaea mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte sterculia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Agelaea mayottensis plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal uses.
